results.overview:
Welcome to our school, where we are dedicated to being the Bridge to Generational Success. Our mission is to provide innovative opportunities that foster both academic and personal growth for every student. We take pride in our culturally responsive approach to teaching and learning, ensuring that all students have equitable access to a rich and diverse educational experience.

As a Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts, and Math (STEAM) institution, we offer a dynamic curriculum that goes beyond traditional subjects. Our unique programming includes:

- Theater, Choir, and Band**: Cultivating creativity and self-expression through the performing arts.
- Financial Literacy**: Equipping students with essential life skills for managing finances.
- Virtual Reality Programming**: Immersing students in cutting-edge technology to enhance learning experiences.
- Advanced Level Courses**: Offering rigorous coursework, including Regents exams in Algebra and Science, along with high school credit for World Language courses.

Our commitment to academic excellence is reflected in our students' achievements; proficiency levels on state exams have shown consistent improvement, demonstrating our upward trajectory in academic performance.

We also prioritize our students' social-emotional well-being. With over eight school-based counselors and social workers, we are dedicated to supporting the whole child, ensuring that each student feels safe, valued, and empowered to thrive.

At our school, we believe that every child has the potential to succeed, and we are here to guide them on their journey. We invite prospective families to join us in this exciting educational adventure, where every student can explore their passions and achieve their dreams.

results.overview:
Magnet schools are public school options that provide a school-wide curriculum designed around a specific theme. They are intended to attract a diverse pool of applicants and historically have accommodated students from outside their zone or district. While some schools may have the word "magnet" in their school's name, only a school that currently gets Magnet Schools Assistance Program (M.S.A.P) funding is labeled as a "magnet school" on it's MySchools page. This magnet school offers a school-wide curriculum around the theme of Global Studies and Leadership. At PS/MS 200: The Magnet School of Global Studies & Leadership, students graduate with a profound appreciation for diversity, an understanding of the challenges facing people around the world, and the skills that will enable them to effect change in the 21st century. 

Through an emphasis on global competence and geographic literacy, our students learn to be innovators and leaders in the world community. They use multimedia and computer technology as tools to gather, organize, analyze, and create digital content and as platforms to communicate with students and families across the globe. 

Our school integrates global studies and leadership seamlessly into the core subjects, and students in our upper grades are also able to pursue "Enrichment Courses" through the School-wide Enrichment Model. Teachers, staff developers, and school leaders work together to create a 3K-8 Scope & Sequence for Global Studies and Leadership that incorporates the NYC Scope & Sequences for Science and Social Studies. 

The overarching goals of our Magnet program are to promote acceptance and diversity, to create learning opportunities that engage students in problem solving at the global level, and to produce future leaders who want to make a difference. Our school challenges students to consider the important question: How can I become a leader in todayâs world?

results.overview:
At P.S. 222, we are a highly professional and dedicated staff committed to creating a school community of independent thinkers with a love of learning. Our goal is to challenge our students in a culturally affirming, inclusive and nurturing early childhood environment to meet their full academic potential. With equity in mind, we aspire for each student to receive the resources and educational opportunities they need to learn and thrive through a high quality curriculum and a strong team of teachers, administrators and service providers. We will address our students’ social and emotional growth through continued guidance and monitoring, including varied strategies and supportive measures.

Our motto is “Inspiring Greatness, One Child At A Time…”

results.overview:
PS 140 has 2 vibrant kindergarten classes dedicated to providing a nurturing and safe environment for young learners. With a maximum of 25 kids in each class, we ensure that every child receives the attention and support they need to thrive.

Mission Statement: âThe PS 140 community will engage in relevant, rigorous instruction in a nurturing and safe environment to foster independence. We will collaborate with families to support academic, emotional, and social growth for all.â

At PS 140, we believe in the power of small group instruction, particularly in phonics, to build strong foundational skills in our students. Our approach allows for personalized learning experiences that cater to the unique needs of each child.

We are committed to meeting children where they are through our social-emotional commitment and restorative practices. This ensures that every child feels valued and supported in their journey towards independence and growth.

We place a high value on family involvement and believe that their voices matter. By working closely with families, we create a supportive community that enhances the academic, emotional, and social development of our students.

Join us at PS 140, where we are committed to fostering independence and growth in every child through collaborative and engaging educational experiences.

results.overview: Magnet schools are public school options that provide a school-wide curriculum designed around a specific theme. They are intended to attract a diverse pool of applicants and historically have accommodated students from outside their zone or district. While some schools may have the word "magnet" in their school's name, only a school that currently gets Magnet Schools Assistance Program (M.S.A.P) funding is labeled as a "magnet school" on it's MySchools page. This magnet school offers a school-wide curriculum around the theme of Global Conservation and Service Learning. Enrollment in kindergarten to sixth grade in a public elementary does not guarantee school bus service. For more information please visit schools.nyc.gov/BusEligibility. The Intensive Reading Education and Development (IREAD) program is a literacy program, in an integrated co-teaching setting where students receive focused and individualized instruction through a reading intervention that is provided during all subjects to support literacy, language, and speech skills. For more information, speak with your CSE or IEP team and refer to schools.nyc.gov/SpecializedPrograms.

results.overview:
P.S. 170, The Ralph A. Fabrizio School, is a historic landmark in Bay Ridge, Brooklyn, located at 619 72nd Street. Established in 1915, the school expanded in 2015 to accommodate a growing student body. Currently, it serves 850 students from kindergarten through fifth grade.

The curriculum at P.S. 170 is comprehensive, offering:

1. Core subjects: English language arts, mathematics, science, and social studies
2. Enrichment programs: Physical education, Junior Great Books, music, visual arts, dance, band, chorus, and violin

A standout feature is the school's prestigious Chinese dual language program, which is highly regarded in District 20. 

P.S. 170 consistently outperforms similar schools in both the district and city, demonstrating its commitment to academic excellence and well-rounded education.

results.overview: River East Elementary is a small school located in East Harlem. Our school has 264 students from Pre-K 3 - 5th Grade. Our school is comprised of 53% Hispanic students, 36% African American students and 6% White students. 54% of our students are female and 46% are male. Our ELL population is 7% and 30% of our students receive special education services. In addition to our academic program, we offer students opportunities to explore art, music, dance, and theater. We have long standing partnerships with organizations like the Asphalt Green, 92nd St YMCA, which allow our students to experience chorus, theater, ceramics, and swimming as part of their weekly schedule. We believe that exploration of art, music, dance, and theater will help them find at least one area they are passionate about for life. As a small school, we are able to establish a close-knit community and culture. Our teachers are able to get to know students as individuals, both the students they teach and students in other classes as well. We meet as a school each week for our "Town Meeting," where we sing songs, share work, and talk about community issues.

This school has a Bilingual Special Education (BSE) program: Open to students recommended for Bilingual Special Education (BSE) on their Individualized Education Plan (IEP). If your child is recommended for BSE on their IEP and you have questions, visit www.schools.nyc.gov/specializedprograms or contact BSEprograms@schools.nyc.gov.  This school has ASD Nest: Open to students currently enrolled in the ASD (Autism Spectrum Disorder) Nest program. If you are applying to ASD programs for the first time, please visit www.schools.nyc.gov/specializedprograms for the application and contact ASDprograms@schools.nyc.gov with questions.
